Keywords: Avengers , Great Lakes Avengers , Thunderbolts
Real Name: Clint Barton
Special Powers
ALL I NEED IS MY TRUSTY BOW: When Hawkeye makes a range attack, you may choose to modify either attack -or- range +2.
TRICK ARROWS: When Hawkeye hits, after resolutions he may use either Smoke Cloud or Barrier as FREE, but only to generate 1 marker adjacent to or in the square of a hit opposing character.
ARROW DOWN THE BARREL: When an opposing character within range and line of fire makes a range attack, roll 2d6. If the result is equal to or higher than the finalized attack roll, that attack misses all targets.
Linked Units
AV056
Hawkeye 56 8

Comments
February 8, 2022
tidge
My biggest complaint about THIS choice of Legacy card is that it goes with a figure from the 2007 Avengers set... because that set uniformly had the worst dials for actual turning purposes. I would have also preferred if the new point value was 50 points, so he could join "Cap Thanos' Kooky Quartet". The Trick arrows and "Down the Barrel" are decent tricks to add to such an old figure. I feel like this figure may be able to earn its (reduced) points on teams that have Mastermind.
January 22, 2022
fastcat99
Well, he's kindof wimpy, but for only 45 points, if you get one good hit in and then he sticks a couple of arrows down the barrel, it's a win! And really, when he hits the back half of the dial, he's not an attack threat, so hopefully your opponent ignores him and takes aim at the other characters and gets an arrow down the barrel. That would be the highlight of my game and I'd consider it a win either way.

Same with Xplosion vet Taskmaster being remade in CAAV.

SpaceTitanium
He already has RCE on the dial, having it in the attack slot would be redundant on those last 2 clicks. his trait covers that already by giving him +2 attack/range which is already better than RCE would be and combos with his late dial RCE in an attempt to make his 6 attack not as laughable.

Buckwheat
I'm really disappointed by "Trick Arrows". In a world where nearly everyone without a move-and-attack power has Sidestep, it's almost inconsequential. He's not worth using without the Thunderbolts ATA.

My thing is this: He's freaking Hawkeye!! You don't give him RCE in his attack SP or at least trait it? I could see the point cost being higher than 45pts for the power all down the dial, but at least get the powerset right!

harodihg
it would be cool if that defense power was top dial and you could load up a bunch of them and just make the opponent miserable
December 9, 2021
Hawk1113
He is one of the cheapest "carded" Hawkeyes, especially for an Avengers, Thunderbolts, or GLA team. With finesse, I can see him being frustrating to play against - 8 range is long in today's game, and he can go to 10 range if you're feeling lucky with his (bad) attack rolls. A hit can then make it really hard for an enemy to base him (Smoke Cloud as FREE) or tricky for an opponent that doesn't have some sorta move-and-attack to get line of fire (Barrier as FREE) with his silly ol' trick arrows. But I'd always pay 5 more points for any of his other recent versions. His paper-thin defenses mean he's going down fast even with his long (for modern day) dial. He has reliable, good attack thanks to his trait, but can only break reducers on his very first click. If he ever misses (and an 11 attack still isn't AMAZING) or gets based, he's just dead.
December 8, 2021
Goop
Will just die way too quickly. Even with +2 atk his stats are way too low for the current game.
